data.title: DerekFisher.com Staff, Author at The Official Web Site of Derek Fisher . Analyst . Coach . Five
data.meta_site_name: The Official Web Site of Derek Fisher . Analyst . Coach . Five-Time NBA World Champion
data.text:
Derek Joins Turner as Guest Analyst

Derek Fisher is going to be putting his many years of postseason experience to good use as the NBA season makes its final push to the playoffs this week. Turner Sports announced on Monday that they have brought Derek on as a guest analyst this week on two of their shows. He will make his [...]

By | April 4th, 2016|News|

Fish Gets First Win With Summer Knicks

In his first game as a pro basketball coach, Derek Fisher got his first win as a pro basketball coach. On Friday afternoon at the Thomas & Mack Center in Las Vegas, Nevada, Derek guided the New York Knicks’ Summer League team to a 76-64 win over the Dallas Mavericks in the kick-off game for [...]

By | July 12th, 2014|News|

Back on Track

For a team with just seven losses in 32 games, a losing streak is an oddity, so back-to-back home losses to the Portland Trail Blazers and Brooklyn Nets were a bit mystifying to the Oklahoma City Thunder. But the Thunder got back to their winning ways over the weekend. Oklahoma City went into Minnesota on [...]

By | January 6th, 2014|News|

Holiday Rout in New York

Coming off their toughest loss of the season to date, the Oklahoma City Thunder were looking to make a statement. Where better to do it than on Broadway. The Thunder made it a Merry Christmas for fans back in Oklahoma City with a rout of the New York Knicks 123-94 in a Christmas Day matinee [...]

By | December 26th, 2013|News|

Streaks End at Home

A road-home back-to-back spelled the end of a couple of long streaks for the Oklahoma Thunder on Sunday. Fresh off an impressive 13-point win over the Spurs on Saturday in San Antonio, Derek Fisher and the Thunder faltered for the first time in more than two weeks Sunday, losing 104-98 to the Toronto Raptors. The [...]

By | December 23rd, 2013|News|

Thunder Keeps Rolling

A dozen was the Magic number for the Oklahoma City Thunder this week as they extended another long streak with back-to-back 12-point wins. On Tuesday night, the Thunder went into Denver and defeated the Nuggets by 12. Two nights later , they won by the same margin at home against the Chicago Bulls. The victories [...]

By | December 20th, 2013|News|

Meeting at a Crossroads

Few chances remain for Derek Fisher to lace up his shoes against his longtime team, the Los Angeles Lakers. So when Derek learned last week that Kobe Bryant would be returning in time for the first meeting between the Lakers and Fish’s Thunder this season, No. 6 was glad he’d get to share the floor [...]

By | December 16th, 2013|News|

Thunder Embark on Another Streak

A December 4th loss in Portland appears to have been just a speed bump for Derek Fisher and the Oklahoma City Thunder. The Thunder capped a dominant week on Wednesday night in Memphis with a 116-100 victory over the Grizzlies, marking their fourth straight win since losing to the Blazers. In those four wins, OKC’s [...]

By | December 12th, 2013|News|

Thunder Bounce Back To Topple Pelicans

Two nights after a hard-fought defeat at the hands of the Portland Trail Blazers, the Oklahoma City Thunder got back on the winning track to end their week-long road trip on a high note. Derek Fisher chipped in four points, three rebounds, three steals, and was a +14 in 13 and a half minutes as [...]

By | December 7th, 2013|News|
